solution_line_template: The first {first_pull_duration}-minute chain pull caused the balloon to rise {rise_rate_pulled}*{first_pull_duration}=<<{rise_rate_pulled}*{first_pull_duration}={elevation_after_first_pull}>>{elevation_after_first_pull} feet.

Releasing the chain for {first_release_duration} minutes caused the balloon to descend {descend_rate_released}*{first_release_duration}=<<{descend_rate_released}*{first_release_duration}={descent_amount}>>{descent_amount} feet.

The second {second_pull_duration}-minute chain pull caused the balloon to rise another {rise_rate_pulled}*{second_pull_duration}=<<{rise_rate_pulled}*{second_pull_duration}={elevation_after_second_pull}>>{elevation_after_second_pull} feet.

Thus, at the end of the second chain pull, when the balloon was at its highest elevation, the balloon had risen to an elevation of {elevation_after_first_pull}-{descent_amount}+{elevation_after_second_pull}=<<{elevation_after_first_pull}-{descent_amount}+{elevation_after_second_pull}={highest_elevation}>>{highest_elevation} feet above the earth's surface.
